show.subtitle: Stories and news that affect us all
show.title: Leid Stories

title: One Man’s Quest for Justice (Part 2)
content:
He was a young Secret Service agent in Chicago in 1960 when he was asked by President John F. <!--more--> Kennedy himself to join the White House Secret Service detail.
Abraham Bolden by then had been the first African American in several law-enforcement positions he’d held; this was a dream come true.
But soon, Bolden found himself at odds with sketchy security practices and made it known.
When Kennedy was assassinated, he tried to expose the agency’s negligence, only to find himself the victim of a sinister conspiracy that affects his life even to this day.
